title: Aptitude and Programming Test 3
description: A comprehensive test for MITS students covering Quantitative Aptitude and Basic Programming skills.
instructions:
1. Complete all sections: Aptitude MCQs and Programming Questions
2. Each coding solution must handle basic test cases
3. Time management is crucial - attempt all questions
4. Read each question carefully before answering

mcqs.question: 3 pumps, working 8 hours a day, can empty a tank in 2 days. How many hours a day must 4 pumps work to empty the tank in 1 day?
mcqs.explanation: Let the required number of working hours per day be x. More pumps, Less working hours per day (Indirect Proportion). Less days, More working hours per day (Indirect Proportion). Using proportion: 4 × 1 × x = 3 × 2 × 8, solving for x = 12

mcqs.question: If the cost of x metres of wire is d rupees, then what is the cost of y metres of wire at the same rate?
mcqs.explanation: Cost of x metres = Rs. d. Cost of 1 metre = Rs. d/x. Cost of y metres = Rs. (d/x) × y = Rs. yd/x

mcqs.question: If the cost price of shoes doubles, then the loss gets tripled of what it was initially. The initial loss % was?
mcqs.explanation: Let CP = 100 and Loss be X. SP = CP - X = 100 - X. When CP doubles and loss triples: SP = 200 - 3X. Solving: 100 - X = 200 - 3X gives X = 50, so initial loss was 50%

mcqs.question: A car dealer sold two cars for Rs 45,000 each. One yielded him 25 percent profit on outlay. On the other he lost 25 percent. The profit/loss incurred by the dealer in rupees is
mcqs.explanation: SP of both cars = Rs 90000. For first car: CP + 25% of CP = 45000, so CP = 36000. For second car: CP - 25% of CP = 45000, so CP = 60000. Total CP = 96000. Loss = 6000

mcqs.question: A man bought a number of articles for Rs.100; 3 of them were broken, but by selling each of the rest at 12.5% above cost price he made a profit of Rs.8. How many articles did he buy?
mcqs.explanation: Let n be the number of articles. C.P. of each article = Rs.100/n. S.P. of each article = Rs.108/(n - 3). (100/n) x (112.5/100) = 108/(n-3) => n = 75

mcqs.question: A man buys oranges at 9 for Rs. 1.60 and sells them at 11 for Rs. 2. What is his gain or loss percent?
mcqs.explanation: Taking LCM of 11 and 9 = 99 oranges. CP = 99x1.60/9 = Rs. 17.60. SP = 99 X 2/11 = Rs. 18. Gain = 40 Paise. Gain percent = (40/1760)X 100 = 2(3/11)%

mcqs.question: A man sells an item for 700 and makes some profit. Then he sells the same item for 500 and his loss is 3/5th of the earlier profit. What is his approximate loss percentage in the second transaction?
mcqs.explanation: In First Transaction, SP1= 700; Profit= 700 - CP. In Second Transaction, CP - 500 = 3/5(700 - CP). Solving we get CP= 575. Loss %= (75/575)*100= 13%

mcqs.question: A man sold 12 candies at Rs. 10 had loss of b%, then again sold 12 candies at Rs. 12 had profit of b%. Find the value of b.
mcqs.explanation: Let CP be x. Then: x-10 = bx/100 and 12-x = bx/100. Solving these equations gives b = 9.09%

mcqs.question: A merchant makes a profit of 20% even after allowing a discount of 20% on the marked price. What should be the marked price if the cost price of the article is Rs.300?
mcqs.explanation: CP = 300, SP = 360 (20% profit). Let MP be x. 80% of x = 360. Therefore x = 360*(100/80) = 450

mcqs.question: After allowing a discount of 11.11%, a trader still makes a gain of 14.28%. At how many percent above the cost price does he mark on his goods?
mcqs.explanation: Let CP be X. Then SP = 1.1428X. SP = 0.8889 MP. 0.8889 MP = 1.1428X. Therefore MP = 1.2856X, meaning marked up 28.56% above CP

mcqs.question: A student first decreased a number by 50% and then increased the decreased number by 50%. The number so obtained is 80 less than the original number. What was the original number?
mcqs.explanation: Let original number be 100. After 50% decrease = 50. After 50% increase of 50 = 75. Difference is 25. If 25 = 80, then 100 = 320

mcqs.question: If the annual increase in the population of a town be 10% and the present population be 13310, then what was it three years ago?
mcqs.explanation: Let X be the initial population. X[1 + (10/100)]^3 = 13310. Therefore X = 10000

mcqs.question: In an examination, a candidate who gets 30% of the maximum marks fails by 100 marks. But another candidate who gets 42% marks gets 20 marks more than necessary marks. What is the passing mark?
mcqs.explanation: Let X be maximum marks. 30% of X + 100 = 42% of X – 20. 12% of X = 120. X = 1000. Pass marks = 0.3X + 100 = 400

mcqs.question: The length of a rectangle increases by 10% and the breath diminished by 25%. How does its area change?
mcqs.explanation: New length = 11x/10, new breadth = 3y/4. New area = 33xy/40. Reduced area = xy - 33xy/40 = 7xy/40. Percentage decrease = 17.5%

mcqs.question: The price of sugar increases by 50%. In order to restore the original price, the new price must be reduced by
mcqs.explanation: If price increases by 50%, to restore original price, new price must be reduced by 33 1/3%

mcqs.question: Population of a village is 8000. If 6% men and 10% women are added, population becomes 8,600 then the number of men in the village was
mcqs.explanation: Let x = men, y = women. 0.06x + 0.1y = 600 and x + y = 8000. Solving gives x = 5000, y = 3000

mcqs.question: Total income of Eesha in the years 2003, 2004, 2005 was $36,400. Her income increased by 20% each year. What was her income in 2005?
Complete the missing term in the series 1, 6, 15, ?, 45, 66, 91.
mcqs.explanation: Pattern: Each difference increases by 4. 6-1=5, 15-6=9, 28-15=13, 45-28=17, 66-45=21, 91-66=25. Therefore missing number is 28

mcqs.question: Out of 5 women and 4 men a committee of three members is to be formed in such a way that at least one member is a woman. In how many different ways can it be done?
mcqs.explanation: 1 woman, 2 men: 5C1*4C2 = 5*6=30, 2 women, 1 man: 5C2*4C1 = 10*4=40, 3 women, 0 men: 5C3 = 10. Total = 80

mcqs.question: Town D is to the West of town M. Town R is to the South of town D. Town K is to the East of town R. Town K is towards which direction of town D?
mcqs.explanation: By plotting the towns on a direction grid, K is South-East of D

mcqs.question: A cube of side 4 cm is painted black on the pair of one surfaces, blue on the pair of another opposite surfaces and red on the pair of opposite surfaces. The cube is now divided into smaller cubes of equal side of 1 cm each. Then find the no. of smaller cubes with one surface painted.
mcqs.explanation: On each face, the inner smaller cubes other than the ones on the edges will have 1 side painted. 4 small cubes on each face, total 6 faces = 24 cubes

mcqs.question: Pointing out to a photograph, Shaloo said, 'Her son's father is the son in law of my mother.' How is Shaloo related to the lady?
mcqs.explanation: Her son's father is Shaloo's sister's husband, making the lady Shaloo's sister

mcqs.question: How often are the hands of a clock at right angle everyday?
mcqs.explanation: Right angle occurs 22 times in 12 hours. In 24 hours = 44 times

mcqs.question: Find the correct pair analogy for 3265:4376 :: 4673:?
mcqs.explanation: The difference between each pair is 1111. 4376 - 3265 = 1111, therefore 5784 - 4673 = 1111

mcqs.question: If ROAST is coded as PQYUR in a certain language then how will SLOPPY be coded?
mcqs.explanation: The series follows pattern -2, +2, -2. Applying same pattern to SLOPPY gives QNMRNA

mcqs.question: What is Nikita's share in the profit of Rs. 50,000 earned in the business run by her in partnership with Sharmila? I. Nikita invested an amount 150% of the amount invested by Sharmila. II. Amount invested by Sharmila is two-third of the amount invested by Nikita.
mcqs.explanation: Either statement alone is sufficient to determine Nikita's share

mcqs.question: What is the two digit number? I. Sum of the digits is 6. II. Digit in the ten's place is double the digit in the unit's place.
mcqs.explanation: Both statements together are needed to determine the number is 42 (4+2=6 and 4=2×2)

mcqs.question: A number when divided by a divisor leaves a remainder of 25. When twice the original number is divided by the same divisor, the remainder is 11. What is the value of the divisor?
mcqs.explanation: When twice the original number is divided, remainder should be 50. The remainder of 11 was obtained by dividing 50 by divisor. When 50 is divided by 39, remainder is 11. Hence 39 is the divisor.

mcqs.question: Three years back, a father was 24 years older than his son. At present the father is 5 times as old as the son. How old will the son be three years from now?
mcqs.explanation: Let present age of son be S and father be F. F-3 = (S-3) + 24 and F = 5S. Solving gives S = 6. Three years from now son's age will be 9 years.

mcqs.question: A, B and C, each of them working alone can complete a job in 10, 12 and 15 days respectively. If all three of them work together to complete a job and earn Rs. 6000, what will be C's share of the earnings?
mcqs.explanation: Work = 60 units (LCM of 10,12,15). A does 6 units/day, B does 5 units/day, C does 4 units/day. C's contribution is 4/15 of total. C's share = 6000 × (4/15) = Rs.1600

mcqs.question: In what ratio should a 20% methyl alcohol solution be mixed with a 50% methyl alcohol solution so that the resultant solution has 40% methyl alcohol in it?
mcqs.explanation: Using allegation: 0.2x + 0.5y = 0.4(x+y). Solving gives x:y = 1:2

mcqs.question: The average monthly salary of 10 workers and 2 managers in a company was Rs. 18,000. When one of the managers whose salary was Rs. 24,000, was replaced with a new manager, the average salary of the team went up to Rs. 19,000. What is the salary of the new manager?
mcqs.explanation: Original total = 12 × 18,000 = 216,000. New total = 12 × 19,000 = 228,000. Difference = 12,000. New manager salary = 24,000 + 12,000 = 36,000

mcqs.question: 40% of 80 is x% more than 20% of 120. Find x.
The difference between the compound interest and the simple interest on a certain sum at 10% p.a. for two years is Rs. 90. What will be the value of the amount at the end of 3 years, assuming SI?
Two trains of lengths 125 m and 175 m cross each other in 12 seconds. If the speed of one of the trains is 40 km/h, what is the speed of the other train?
mcqs.explanation: Relative speed = (125+175)/12 = 25 m/s = 90 km/h. If one train's speed is 40 km/h, other train's speed = 50 km/h

mcqs.question: In how many ways can 8 letters be posted in 4 post boxes, if any number of letters can be posted in all of the four post boxes?
mcqs.explanation: Each letter can be posted in 4 ways. For 8 letters, total ways = 48

mcqs.question: There are 2 different blue toys, 3 different green toys and 4 different red toys. In how many ways can one choose 3 toys, such that there is at least one green toy and one blue toy in the chosen three?
mcqs.explanation: Possible combinations: GBR (3×2×4=24 ways), GBB (3×1=3 ways), GBG (3×2=6 ways). Total = 24+3+6 = 33 ways

mcqs.question: What is the approximate value of 242 + 2.42 + 0.242 + 0.0242?
mcqs.explanation: 242 = 576, 2.42 = 5.76, other values are negligible. Total sum is approximately 580

mcqs.question: 3324 – 1724 is at least divisible by
mcqs.explanation: 3324 - 1724 is divisible by (33+17) and (33-17). Therefore divisible by 50 × 16 = 800

mcqs.question: A number is mistakenly divided by 5 instead of being multiplied by 5. Find the percentage change in the result due to this mistake.
mcqs.explanation: Let number be X. Actual value = 5X, Mistake value = X/5. Percentage change = (5X-0.2X)/5X = 0.96X = 96%

mcqs.question: A shopkeeper makes a profit of 20% on every kilogram of rice sold at the rate of Rs.36 per kg. The selling price is reduced in such a way that he gets a profit of Rs.2 per kg. By what percent must his sales increase so that his profit remains the same as before?
mcqs.explanation: CP = 36/1.2 = 30 per kg. Original profit = Rs.6/kg. To maintain same profit with Rs.2/kg, sales must increase by 200%

mcqs.question: A book was sold for a certain sum and there was a loss of 20%. Had it been sold for Rs. 12 more, there would have been a gain of 30%. What would be the profit if the book were sold for Rs. 4.8 more than what it was sold for?
mcqs.explanation: Let CP = x, SP = 0.8x. When SP increases by 12, 1.3x = 0.8x + 12. Solving gives x = 24, original SP = 19.2. New SP = 24 equals CP, so no profit no loss

mcqs.question: A sum of money placed at compound interest doubles itself in 3 years. In how many years will it amount to 8 times itself?
mcqs.explanation: If amount doubles in 3 years, 8 times means 2³ = 8, so it will take 3 × 3 = 9 years

mcqs.question: The rate of interest for first 3 years is 6% per annum, for the next 4 years, 7% per annum and for the period beyond 7 years, 7.5% per annum. If a man lent out Rs.1200 for 11 years, find the total interest earned by him?
mcqs.explanation: Interest for first 3 years = 18%, next 4 years = 28%, remaining 4 years = 30%. Total = 76% of 1200 = Rs.912

mcqs.question: A fast train takes 3 hours less than a slow train for a journey of 600 km. If the speed of the slow train is 10 km/hr less than that of the fast train, then the speeds of two trains are
mcqs.explanation: Let fast train speed be x. Then (600/x-10) - (600/x) = 3. Solving gives x = 50, slow train speed = 40

mcqs.question: A bus 270 metres can cross a bridge 180 metres long completely in 50 seconds. How long it will take to cross a telegraph pole 20 m high?
mcqs.explanation: Total distance = 270 + 180 = 450m, Speed = 450/50 = 9 m/s. Time to cross pole = 270/9 = 30 sec (pole height irrelevant)

mcqs.question: How many different straight lines can be formed by joining 12 different points on a plane of which four are collinear and the rest are non collinear?
A box contains 7 red, 6 white and 4 blue balls. How many selection of three balls can be made so that all three are red balls?
mcqs.explanation: Selection of 3 red balls from 7 red balls = 7C3 = 35

mcqs.question: Simplify: 3 log 5 + 2 log 4 – log 2 =?
mcqs.explanation: 3 log 5 + 2 log 4 - log 2 = log 125 + log 16 - log 2 = log (125 × 16)/2 = log 1000 = 3

mcqs.question: If four dice are thrown simultaneously, what is the probability of getting exactly the same number in each dice?
mcqs.explanation: Favorable outcomes = 6 (same number on all dice), Total outcomes = 6⁴ = 1296. Probability = 6/1296 = 1/216

mcqs.question: From a book containing 100 page one page is selected randomly. What is the probability that the sum of the digits of the page number of the selected page is 11?
mcqs.explanation: Favorable pages: 29, 92, 38, 83, 47, 74, 56, 65 (8 pages). Probability = 8/100 = 2/25

mcqs.question: If 5ᵃ = 3125, then the value of 5(a - 3) is?
mcqs.explanation: 5ᵃ = 3125 = 5⁵, so a = 5. Therefore 5(a-3) = 5² = 25

mcqs.question: A train running at 54 km/hr crosses a platform in 20 seconds. If the length of the train is 150 meters, what is the length of the platform?
mcqs.explanation: Train speed = 54 km/hr = 15 m/s. Total distance = Speed × Time = 15 × 20 = 300m. Platform length = Total distance - Train length = 300 - 150 = 200m

mcqs.question: If log 2 = 0.3010 and log 3 = 0.4771, then the value of log 72 is:
A shopkeeper bought 30 kg of rice at Rs. 40 per kg and 20 kg of rice at Rs. 50 per kg. He mixed them and sold the mixture at Rs. 48 per kg. His profit percentage is:
Three numbers are in the ratio 2:3:5. The sum of their squares is 608. The smallest number is:
mcqs.explanation: Let numbers be 2x, 3x, 5x. (2x)² + (3x)² + (5x)² = 608. 38x² = 608. x = 4. Smallest number = 2x = 8

mcqs.question: A cylindrical vessel of diameter 14 cm contains water to a depth of 10 cm. A sphere is dropped into it and the water level rises by 5.6 cm. The diameter of the sphere is:
mcqs.explanation: Volume of water risen = πr²h = π×7²×5.6. Volume of sphere = (4/3)πR³. Equating gives R = 6cm, diameter = 12cm

mcqs.question: If tan A = 3/4, then the value of (sin A + cos A) is:
mcqs.explanation: If tan A = 3/4, then sin A = 3/5 and cos A = 4/5 (using Pythagorean identity). Therefore sin A + cos A = 5/5 = 5/√25

mcqs.question: A boat covers 24 km upstream and 24 km downstream in 6 hours. The same boat covers 24 km upstream and 24 km downstream in 8 hours in another river. The ratio of the rates of current in the first and second river is:
mcqs.explanation: Let speed of boat be u and currents be c1, c2. Solving equations gives c1:c2 = 3:2

mcqs.question: The average weight of 8 persons increases by 2.5 kg when one person weighing 65 kg is replaced by a new person. The weight of the new person is:
mcqs.explanation: Total increase = 8 × 2.5 = 20 kg. New person's weight = 65 + 20 = 85 kg

mcqs.question: The difference between simple interest and compound interest on a certain sum for 2 years at 4% per annum is Rs. 1. The sum is:
mcqs.explanation: CI - SI = P(1+r/100)² - P(1+2r/100) = 1. Solving gives P = 625

mcqs.question: A can do a work in 15 days and B in 20 days. They work together for 4 days and then B leaves. In how many days will A finish the remaining work?
mcqs.explanation: Work done in 4 days = (1/15 + 1/20)×4 = 28/60. Remaining work = 32/60. A will take (32/60)/(1/15) = 8 days

codingChallenges.title: String Reversal
codingChallenges.description: Write a program to reverse a given string
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Create a function that takes a string as input and returns the reversed string.

codingChallenges.title: Grade Calculator
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program that takes marks (0-100) as input and returns the grade: A(90-100), B(80-89), C(70-79), D(60-69), F(0-59)

testCases.explanation: 95 is in the range 90-100, so grade is A
75 is in the range 70-79, so grade is C

codingChallenges.title: Sum of Digits
codingChallenges.description: Calculate sum of digits using while loop
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program that calculates the sum of digits of a given number using while loop. Example: 123 → 6 (1+2+3)

codingChallenges.title: Vowel Counter
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program that counts the number of vowels (a,e,i,o,u) in a given string. Ignore case.

testCases.explanation: Found vowels: A, E, I, O, U

codingChallenges.title: Temperature Converter
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program that converts temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit. Formula: F = (C × 9/5) + 32

codingChallenges.title: Factorial Calculator
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to calculate factorial of a number using while loop. Example: 5! = 5×4×3×2×1 = 120

codingChallenges.title: Palindrome Check
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to check if a string is palindrome (reads same forwards and backwards). Return 'Yes' or 'No'.

codingChallenges.title: Largest of Three
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to find the largest among three given numbers.

codingChallenges.title: Multiplication Table
codingChallenges.description: Print multiplication table using while loop
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to print multiplication table of a given number up to 10 using while loop.

codingChallenges.title: Case Converter
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to convert a given string to uppercase.

codingChallenges.title: Positive Negative Zero
codingChallenges.description: Check if number is positive, negative or zero
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to check if a number is positive, negative or zero. Return 'Positive', 'Negative' or 'Zero'.

codingChallenges.title: Digit Counter
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to count the number of digits in a given number using while loop.

codingChallenges.title: Word Counter
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to count the number of words in a given string. Words are separated by single space.

codingChallenges.title: Leap Year
codingChallenges.description: Check if year is leap year
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to determine whether a given year is a leap year. Return 'Yes' for leap year and 'No' for non-leap year.

codingChallenges.title: Power Calculator
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to calculate power of a number using while loop. Given base and exponent, calculate base^exponent.

codingChallenges.title: Character Counter
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to count how many times a specific character appears in a string. Return the count.

codingChallenges.title: Number Pattern
codingChallenges.description: Print number pattern using while loop
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to print numbers from 1 to n in a pattern where each line has one more number than the previous line.

codingChallenges.title: Age Category
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program that categorizes age into: 'Child' (0-12), 'Teen' (13-19), 'Adult' (20-59), 'Senior' (60+)

codingChallenges.title: String Trimmer
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to remove leading and trailing spaces from a string.

codingChallenges.title: String Alternator
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to alternate between uppercase and lowercase letters in a string. First letter should be uppercase.

codingChallenges.title: Divisibility Checker
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program that checks if a number is divisible by both 3 and 5. Return 'Yes' if divisible by both, 'No' otherwise.

codingChallenges.title: Digit Sum While
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program using while loop to repeatedly sum the digits of a number until a single digit is obtained.

codingChallenges.title: Vowel Remover
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to remove all vowels (a,e,i,o,u) from a string. Ignore case.

codingChallenges.title: Number Range
codingChallenges.description: Check if number is in range
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to check if a number is within a given range (inclusive). Return 'In Range' or 'Out of Range'.

codingChallenges.title: String Repeater
codingChallenges.problemStatement: Write a program to repeat a given string n times.
